BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h2>How to reproduce the behaviour</denchmark-h>
 
 <denchmark-code>import spacy
 nlp = spacy.load('el')
 doc = nlp.make_doc('Χθες')
 print(doc[0].lemma_)
 </denchmark-code>
 
 <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last):
   File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
   File "token.pyx", line 860, in spacy.tokens.token.Token.lemma_.__get__
 AttributeError: 'GreekLemmatizer' object has no attribute 'lookup'
 </denchmark-code>
 
 <denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
 
 
 spaCy version: 2.1.8
 Platform: Linux-4.19.0-5-amd64-x86_64-with-debian-10.0
 Python version: 3.7.3

comments_0.comment_text:
Thanks! Looks like the lookup method got lost during the recent refactor. I'll add this back.
 Edit: I'm confused how this ever worked, because it looks like the greek lemmatizer never had a lookup method...

comments_1.comment_text:
It probably never worked.
 Wouldn't it be better to have GreekLemmatizer extend Lemmatizer? I think that was the original problem.
 <denchmark-code>class GreekLemmatizer(Lemmatizer):
 </denchmark-code>

comments_2.comment_text: This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
